meta.name: AI-Powered Document Processing & Organization with Gemini, VLM Run & Google Sheets

parameters.content:
## üßæ AI Data Extraction Workflow

**Overview:**
Uploads land in Google Drive ‚Üí Gemini labels doc type ‚Üí VLM Run extracts structured fields with OCR and layout parsing ‚Üí AI Agent maps keys and saves to the right Google Sheet. Change the prompt only to handle any new document type.


**Key Features:**
- üìÅ Auto-monitors a Drive folder
- üîß VLM Run powered extraction for receipts, resumes, claims, physician orders, blueprints, and any custom type
- üß† AI Agent reads a single master index sheet to find the target sheet ID by doc type
- üóÇÔ∏è If a sheet has no headers the Agent creates them from the JSON keys then appends values
- üìù Prompt controls the schema and mapping logic so editing the prompt updates columns and handling


**Perfect for:**
- Expense tracking and audits
- Healthcare and insurance intake
- Resume and HR pipelines
- Construction records and compliance


**Requirements:**
- VLM Run API
- Google Gemini API
- Google Drive and Sheets OAuth2
- n8n AI Agent with prompt that defines types, headers, and key mapping
- A Google Sheet with Columns `Document_Name`, `Spreadsheet_ID` for locating the document storing sheet

## üìÅ Input Processing

**Monitors & downloads receipt files from Google Drive.**

**Process:**
1. Watches designated Drive folder
2. Auto-triggers on new uploads
3. Downloads files for AI processing

**Supported Formats:**
- Images (JPG, PNG, WEBP)
- PDF documents
- Mobile camera uploads
- Scanned receipts

## ü§ñ VLM Run Execute Agent

**Uses Gemini to detect document type and VLM Run Execute Agent node to extract structured data from images or PDFs.**


**Extracts:**
* Important values according to the document type


**Features:**
* Handles poor quality images
* Supports receipts, resumes, claims, physician orders, construction blueprints, and other generic documents
* OCR text recognition with layout parsing and precision

## üìä Data Storage

**Structures and stores extracted data in Google Sheets according to document type automatically.**


**Features:**
- Clean, organized format
- Centralized database for all kind of files
- Auto-appends new entries or headers for any type of document according to the prompt
- Analysis-ready data


**Document Types (can be modified easily by changing the prompt & updating the Sheet which contains the IDs):**
- Resume
- Receipt
- Construction Blueprint
- Physician Order
- Healthcare Claims

nodes.name: Monitor Uploads
nodes.notes: Monitors Google Drive folder for new receipt uploads and triggers processing automatically.

nodes.name: Download File
nodes.notes: Downloads receipt files from Google Drive for AI processing.

parameters.agentPrompt: =check the {{ $json.content.parts[0].text }} document and extract data according to the document type.

parameters.text: analyze the document and reply the document type only

options.systemMessage:
Complete the following tasks using the google sheet tools for the provided json and do not suggest user how to do, complete it yourself using the available tools and just reply necessary failures or success:

First analyze the document(ie. Physician order, claims processing, construction blueprint etc) and search the spreadsheet with ID: '1-e3vUMW_xJ8Gqj7Ifp7hlESl726tnHaqqFf9DYc_1kE' with get rows if its first column has similar document type.
If yes, grab the spreadsheet ID of that document from the second column of the same spreadsheet then simply append the necessary values from the json there as a new row using append row http node(make sure to map the keys accordingly as the header name from the default json keys). If no header was found in the spreadsheet use append row http tool  to create one(make sure to input the key names as headers not the values), then append the values from the json using append row tool again(now the values in its designated key), make sure the first row is the header with key names and second one is with the values.

If no, append a new row with the generalize document name in that spreadsheet and in spreadsheet ID column assign nothing

make sure to follow these format in tools:

-‚Äúurl‚Äù demo in append row http node: https://sheets.googleapis.com/v4/spreadsheets/1g60FR2dAZ6OtJ1NM06le85agaxCWOW11TbxQj45S2Ug/values/Sheet1!A:Z:append
the spreadsheet id will be changed accordingly

-pass spreadsheet ID only in get rows tool‚Äôs ‚Äúdocument‚Äù field

-make sure to check spreadsheet header before sending to append rows http tool

-follow this exact json format in append row‚Äôs body, with necessary values or keys:
{
  "majorDimension": "ROWS",
  "values": [["val1", "val2"]]
}

- make sure to use natural key names and natural values without any nested objects simple natural "key": "value" structure, if value is big use endline(\n) comma etc in it to format naturally and extract the fields as given for each doc type(try to map all the values inside these keys) and pass them accordingly:‚Ä®
Resume: Name, Email, Phone no, Github URL, Linkedin URL, Education, Technical Skills, Projects, Additional Section, Score(according to structure), Comment(all over suitableness)

Receipt: receipt_id, transaction_date, merchant_name, merchant_address, merchant_phone, cashier_name, register_number, customer_name, customer_id, items, subtotal, tax, total, currency, payment_method, discount_amount, discount_description, tip_amount, return_policy, barcode, additional_charges, notes, others

Claims Processing: form_type, form_version, carrier_name, insurance_type, insured_id_number, patient_name, patient_birth_date, patient_sex, patient_address, patient_relationship, insured_name, insured_policy_group, current_illness_date, referring_physician_name, hospitalization_from, hospitalization_to, diagnosis_codes, service_lines, total_charge, amount_paid, balance_due, accept_assignment, billing_provider, service_facility, physician_signature, omb_number

Physician Order: patient_full_name, patient_address_line1, patient_address_city, patient_address_state, patient_address_zip, patient_phone, patient_dob, physician_full_name, referring_clinic, referring_clinic_address_line1, referring_clinic_city, referring_clinic_state, referring_clinic_zip, physician_phone, physician_fax, additional_notes, form_signed_date

Construction Blueprint: project_name, project_id, project_location_line1, project_location_city, project_location_state, project_location_zip, client_full_name, general_contractor_full_name, project_period, permits_approvals, document_type, document_number, document_issue_date, document_author, drawing_titles_numbers, scale_legends, annotations_markups, cad_bim_metadata, title_job_name, title_address_line1, title_address_city, title_address_state, title_address_zip, title_drawing_number, title_revision, title_drawn_by, title_checked_by, title_date, title_scale, title_agency_name, title_document_title, title_sheet_number, title_work_order_number, title_issue_date, title_revision_date, drawing_type, scale_information, environmental_impact

Here‚Äôs three example flow:
1. you analyze the json and found its a claims processing type doc, you search the '1-e3vUMW_xJ8Gqj7Ifp7hlESl726tnHaqqFf9DYc_1kE‚Äô spreadsheet for such type, you found a matching row, fetch the spreadsheet ID of that type, check the header columns using get rows tool and append the json values to that spreadsheet according to columns using append row tool.
2. you analyze the json and found its a construction blueprint type doc, you search the '1-e3vUMW_xJ8Gqj7Ifp7hlESl726tnHaqqFf9DYc_1kE‚Äô spreadsheet for such type, you found a matching row, fetch the spreadsheet ID of that type, use get rows to that and found its blank, use append row tool to add header columns with keys, then check using get rows again and send the values according to header column using append row tool again with the values
3. you analyze the json and found its a resume type doc, you search the fixed spreadsheet and found no such row, then you create a new row with suitable name like resume and in spreadsheet id field assign nothing
